body:
hi @d , could you please rebase next time when merging pull request locally? Since apache standard requires the commit info starting with `HAWQ-ISSUEID.`, please make sure to rebase to delete the additional automerge commit. Thanks.

Bad case: https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/commit/143c0e3f1f0bb7ec44866730657528ced5f05983
Did you tried to use O0 build to break sendWithRetry?
@jiny2 Yes, I can break sendWithRetry in my local mac, Ruilong and Yao can also successfully break sendWithRetry.

@cbaenziger , we have already merged into your ubuntu patch into master(https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/commit/2b418bf3fdd482a9f66a34f1c6e823de745c7645), please close this pull request and related JIRA Issue. Thanks again for contributing to apache/HAWQ. :beer:
@foyzur could you close this PR. thank!
No, 2 months later it is still sitting in the queue.
Any regression tests needed to cover edge case?
@sansanichfb We should add some, but need to run in a secure environment.
@hsyuan ,  code merged, please close this PR.
@foyzur , code merged, please close this PR.

This pull request is closed as it is outdated.
Refer to the below 2 pull requests which solves it more generically for both readable and writable tables.
https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/503
https://github.com/apache/incubator-hawq/pull/604

@hornn the reason we went with returning an empty response was we wanted to be consistent with the way we treat the metadata api based on the given pattern. 
If the pattern has wildcards in it, we will never throw an exception in any case based on table incompatibilities. If the pattern corresponds to a specific table, we will throw the appropriate exception.
+1 on the switch to use messagecontext instead of global variable to store dfs_address
@ictmalili @ztao1987 Please review use of MessageContext for `dfs_address` in `RebuildNamespace`
Merged, please close this PR. Thanks.
Merged, please close this PR. Thanks.
